data.title: Psychology Today: Health, Help, Happiness + Find a Therapist
data.meta_description: View the latest from the world of psychology: from behavioral research to practical guidance on relationships, mental health and addiction. Find help from our directory of therapists, psychologists and counselors.
data.text:
The Latest

Ethics and Morality

Permissive vs. Obligatory Terms in Law and Ethics

If an agency policy sates that clinicians should avoid dual relationships, does this mean they must avoid all dual relationships, or does the policy provide some wiggle room?

If an agency policy sates that clinicians should avoid dual relationships, does this mean they must avoid all dual relationships, or does the policy provide some wiggle room?

Alcoholism

The Truth About the Health Benefits of Alcohol

Is drinking good for your health? This question has long been a topic of scientific debate, and the answer may surprise you. Recent research sheds light on the controversy.

Is drinking good for your health? This question has long been a topic of scientific debate, and the answer may surprise you. Recent research sheds light on the controversy.

Personality

Do Only Jerks Eat Meat?

Is there a link between our personality profiles and the tendency to eat meat or adopt a plant-based diet?

Is there a link between our personality profiles and the tendency to eat meat or adopt a plant-based diet?

Narcissism

The Phases of a Narcissistic Relationship

Relationships with narcissists often follow distinct phases. Here's how to recognize the pattern and begin the voyage toward healing.

Relationships with narcissists often follow distinct phases. Here's how to recognize the pattern and begin the voyage toward healing.

Leadership

Dishonest Leadership Is on the Rise

Dishonest leadership is on the rise. Here are some tips for breaking the cycle and curbing the influence of unethical leaders.

Dishonest leadership is on the rise. Here are some tips for breaking the cycle and curbing the influence of unethical leaders.

Making a big life change doesn't require an abundance of self-confidence.

Burnout

Understanding Burnout Among South Asian American Physicians

What South Asian physicians and experts have to say about their burnout experiences.

What South Asian physicians and experts have to say about their burnout experiences.

Relationships

Struggling to Get Over a Past Painful Relationship?

Ghosts from past relationships can haunt us, keeping us trapped in cycles of fear and isolation. But there is a way to break free and find peace.

Ghosts from past relationships can haunt us, keeping us trapped in cycles of fear and isolation. But there is a way to break free and find peace.

Borderline Personality Disorder

The Need-Fear Dilemma and Adult Psychopathology

Patients beset by a need-fear dilemma have a simultaneous need for and fear of closeness in interpersonal relationships.

Patients beset by a need-fear dilemma have a simultaneous need for and fear of closeness in interpersonal relationships.

Autism

Sensory Profiles, Person-Environment ‘Fit,' and Autism

Each of us has a unique sensory profile that "fits" some situations better than others. Autistic sensory profiles tend to "fit" less often, but accommodations and adaptations help.

Each of us has a unique sensory profile that "fits" some situations better than others. Autistic sensory profiles tend to "fit" less often, but accommodations and adaptations help.

Sex

Are You Heteroflexible?

Your sexual orientation is more complex than you think. Here's what to know about heteroflexibility and whether it may define you.

Your sexual orientation is more complex than you think. Here's what to know about heteroflexibility and whether it may define you.

Anxiety

Should You Avoid That Difficult Conversation?

It can be tempting to avoid tough conversations, but is there a cost?

It can be tempting to avoid tough conversations, but is there a cost?

Psychosis

Using Metaphors to Deal With Psychosis

How can providing a choice between a red pill and a blue pill help a patient dealing with psychosis?

How can providing a choice between a red pill and a blue pill help a patient dealing with psychosis?

Grief

I Need to Make a Call: Using a Wind Phone to Express Grief

There is a powerful psychological and emotional process at work that transcends logic when you pick up the receiver of a wind phone and dial the number of a lost loved one.

There is a powerful psychological and emotional process at work that transcends logic when you pick up the receiver of a wind phone and dial the number of a lost loved one.

Relationships

Should You Stay or Should You Go?

Does your relationship feel like it’s too good to leave and too bad to stay? You might have fallen prey to the “sunk cost fallacy."

Does your relationship feel like it’s too good to leave and too bad to stay? You might have fallen prey to the “sunk cost fallacy."

Executive Function

Getting Help With Executive Function

Growing your executive function skills requires some executive function, leaving many of us in a challenging cycle of wanting to change but feeling stuck.

Growing your executive function skills requires some executive function, leaving many of us in a challenging cycle of wanting to change but feeling stuck.

Adverse Childhood Experiences

Healing from Adverse Childhood Experiences Is Possible

Personal Perspective: After 30 years of research and interviews, I discovered that healing from childhood adversity is always possible

Personal Perspective: After 30 years of research and interviews, I discovered that healing from childhood adversity is always possible

Body Image

Raising Kids in a Diet-Obsessed Culture

Discover essential strategies to help children develop a positive, balanced relationship with food and their bodies.

Discover essential strategies to help children develop a positive, balanced relationship with food and their bodies.

Relationships

Living With an Intimate Terrorist: The Damage of Control

Even when coercive abuse isn’t doing damage physically, it is eroding self-esteem and mental health. It is important to seek healing from intimate terrorism.

Even when coercive abuse isn’t doing damage physically, it is eroding self-esteem and mental health. It is important to seek healing from intimate terrorism.

Relationships

What Is a ‘Situationship’? Here Are the Pros and Cons

Is a "situationship" right for you? Well, it depends on the situation. There are pros and cons of such an arrangement and what needs to be in place for it to work.

Is a "situationship" right for you? Well, it depends on the situation. There are pros and cons of such an arrangement and what needs to be in place for it to work.

Gender

No, "Big Dad Energy" Does Not Disrupt Toxic Masculinity

Personal Perspective: So many people are calling Tim Walz an example of masculinity without toxicity. But they’re all wrong. Here's why.

Personal Perspective: So many people are calling Tim Walz an example of masculinity without toxicity. But they’re all wrong. Here's why.

Body Image

How Popular Cosmetic Procedures Are Making You Look Older

The quest for youth might be aging you. Uncover how popular cosmetic procedures could backfire, making you look older instead of younger.

The quest for youth might be aging you. Uncover how popular cosmetic procedures could backfire, making you look older instead of younger.

Extroversion

The Problem With Main Character Energy

Too much of a good thing? How to keep extraversion from turning into attention seeking.

Too much of a good thing? How to keep extraversion from turning into attention seeking.

Artificial Intelligence

The Human-Bot Bond

While there are many benefits of engaging with AI, if used in place of interaction rather than as an adjunct to it, it has the potential to hamper our social connectedness.

While there are many benefits of engaging with AI, if used in place of interaction rather than as an adjunct to it, it has the potential to hamper our social connectedness.

Sport and Competition

Body and Soul: Why Sex Categories Matter in Combat Sports

Differences in sexual development do not mean that biological sex is a spectrum or a matter of choice. Confusion over this is putting women's lives at risk, especially in boxing.

Differences in sexual development do not mean that biological sex is a spectrum or a matter of choice. Confusion over this is putting women's lives at risk, especially in boxing.
